document.docAuthor: Crispolon, Elorde Jr. S., Yap, Sheryl A. & Soulier-Perkins, Adeline
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the endemic Philippine Poeciloterpa Stål (Hemiptera: Cercopidae) with description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the endemic Philippine Poeciloterpa Stål (Hemiptera: Cercopidae) with description of four new species

bibRefCitation.author: Jacobi, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Jacobi, A. (1927) Ueber einige Tomaspidinae (Rhynchota, Homoptera) von den Philippinen. Philippine Journal of Science, Manila, 32, 549 - 551.

subSubSection.paragraph: Jacobi (1927) described this species based on 2 female specimens. The description was mainly based on the coloration.

During our field trips in the Philippines , we collected
Poeciloterpa
specimens in copula in Saray, Pakil, UP Laguna Land Grant, Laguna . The general colour of the female in copula is black while the male is red. When following the identification key of Lallemand (1949) the male and female are identified as being two different species,
P. atra
and
Poeciloterpa minuta Lallemand
, respectively.After dissection of the male terminalia, we compared them with those of the male paratype of
P. minuta
deposited in the NHM. The genitalia are different and the specimens collected in copula do not belong to
P. minuta
.

The type locality of
P. atra
is the Polillo Island in which we collected some material. All the females collected there were black and the males were red ( Figs 15–17 ). The females from Polillo Island including the type ( Figs 11–13 ), deposited in SMTD, and the female in copula from Pakil are morphologically similar. The males collected on Polillo and the male in copula from Pakil present the same genitalia. All these observations lead us to think that a dimorphism in coloration can be observed for the species
P. atra
. As such, we provide here for the first time, the detailed description and illustration of male terminalia ( Figs 19–24 ).

Type material examined. Holotype ♀ : [Polillo, Phiilpp], [coll. A. JACOBI], [1922 2], [Museum für Tierkundi Dresden ( MTD )], [
atra
jac], [Typus], ( SMTD ).
